title: I am writing a poetry book how should it be structured? - Quora

response.answer_text: Poetry book: If it is a collection of poems, then choose a theme - something that links the poems together - and include this collection in an Arial 12 pt font, or at least in a legible font (even if a bit fancy). Every page should have a clear heading or poem title. The foreword should be inspiring, and at the beginning you should also include a table of contents as a quick reference. The editor at the publishing house would polish the content, and choose the cover. However, you could choose a picture for the cover which sets a tone for the book. Should it be a book about poetry (as opposed to a poetry collection) , this would be a different kettle of fish.
